uh: yes I want to hide my realdomain to protect the innocence ;)
you sure that tje /etc/apache2/sotes-enabled/mydomain.com file is *readable* ?
the permission is 644 on that file
you're missing some lines at the top of your default config, in theory
just a min let me paste the whole file again
did you try taking out the <Directory> tags in the 'mydomain.com
aha! I figured it out now ;)
adding ServerName localhost to that default file solved it
I guess the reason is my hostname is set to mydomain.com
and not having a ServerName in default let it assume that localhost is mydomain.com
so the default file listen to localhost and all its names configured in /etc/hosts
at least this is how I understand it now
